# Basic Loaf

> Your simple guide to foolproof sourdough bread with minimal effort.

A project dedicated to making sourdough baking accessible for beginners and busy people. This site provides a hands-off approach to baking bakery-quality bread at home.

## Documentation
- [The Recipe](https://basicloaf.com/recipe.html): Core guide with interactive recipe scaler for sourdough bread.
- [Easy Focaccia](https://basicloaf.com/focaccia.html): Beginner-friendly no-shape sourdough focaccia recipe.
- [Starter Guide](https://basicloaf.com/starter.html): Creating and maintaining your own wild yeast starter.
- [Bought Starter](https://basicloaf.com/bought-starter.html): Activation instructions for purchased mature starter.
- [Baker Tips](https://basicloaf.com/tips.html): Practical tips and troubleshooting advice for sourdough bakers.
- [Techniques](https://basicloaf.com/techniques.html): Visual and textual explanations of folding, shaping, scoring, and baking.
- [Essential Gear](https://basicloaf.com/gear.html): Minimal equipment list for success.
- [Recipe Ideas](https://basicloaf.com/ideas.html): Variations and inspiration for using your sourdough.
- [About](https://basicloaf.com/about.html): Background on the project and author Will Poon.

## Interactive Features
- **Recipe Scaler**: Found on the [Recipe Page](https://basicloaf.com/recipe.html) and [Focaccia Page](https://basicloaf.com/focaccia.html), this JS-powered tool recalculates ingredient weights (flour, water, starter, salt) based on the number of loaves or trays.

## Technical Details
- **Stack**: Semantic HTML5, Vanilla CSS, Vanilla JS.
- **Structure**: Static site, no build tools.
- **Design**: Clean, minimalist aesthetic with consistent list alignment and typography across all pages.
- **Microdata**: Uses Schema.org JSON-LD for Recipes, HowTo (Starter), FAQPage (Tips), and Organizations.
